results.title: Boffins. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, ABC Video and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Ever wonder why the moon stays up, or why sound travels through air? Boffins do. This second volume of the delightful children’s series will both entertain 4-7 year olds and help explain the “Laws of Nature.” The episodes are: “Upwards and downwards” (the force of gravity), “Life in the balance” (the centre of gravity), “Water water everywhere” (how to use a syphon), “The Disappearing water” (the evaporation of water).

results.title: Boffins. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, ABC Video and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Ever wondered why the moon stays up, or why sound travels through air? Boffins do. This delightful series will entertain children from 4-7 and is a fun way to help explain the “Laws of Nature.” In kitchen cupboards throughout the world tiny creatures called Boffins are hard at work experimenting and discovering the scientific rules that govern the universe. Aristotle and Madame Curie are very close to some of the answers but the young Boffins from the house next door, Newton and Echo, are only interested in having fun. The episodes are: “Wrong number” (the nature of sound), “No entry” (the power of the lever), “Over the moon” (how to use pulleys) and “Fridgestuff” (magnetism).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Munro, ABC Video and Film Australia

results.title: Bodyheat = Body heat
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Fred Gallo, Ladd Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Kathleen Turner made her acting debut and Kasdan his directorial debut, in this modern day “film noir”, with a plot resembling that of “Double Indemnity”. Set in Florida, William Hurt plays attorney Ned Racine. His involvement with the seductive Matty Walker, played by Turner, leads him down the path to murder as they plot to kill her husband, played by Richard Crenna. Turner and Hurt’s performances are excellent, yet the film received mixed reactions. Some critics applauded Kasdan’s effort to translate the “film noir” genre of the 1940’s into the more sexually permissable 1980’s, while others saw it as a poor remake of a film classic. “Body Heat” has the elements of steamy passion, intrigue and murder and features Ted Danson and Mickey Rourke in supporting roles.

results.title: Body, Mind and Massage - Relaxing Together
results.brief_description: This creative video is a guide to relaxation and health improvement through the science and art of massage in a format especially designed for couples. Learn how to use time together for regular periods of massage therapy that can release stress and tension, relieve muscular pain and fatigue, reduce sinus conditions or headaches, even improve circulation. Fully demonstrated, easy to follow instructions allow you to quickly learn the basic principles and techniques of massage. Rated: G

results.title: Body Melt
results.creator_credit: Philip Brophy, Daniel Scharf, Rod Bishop, 1 for Dumb Films, Australian Film Commission and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Brophy, Daniel Scharf, Rod Bishop, 1 for Dumb Films, Australian Film Commission and Film Victoria
results.description: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug. Some will survive but most will not! The first phase is hallucinogenic, the second phase is glandular and the third phase is Body Melt! “An inventive and laudably tasteless journey into the surreal” Sight & Sound (UK). “Packs more mucous, phlegm, puke, snot, slime and spit than you ever thought possible” Starburst (UK). If you enjoyed “Salt, saliva, sweat and sperm” in the ‘80’s by the same producers and director, then this is the ‘90’S experience you have been craving! Based on four short stories by Philip Brophy. Starring Gerard Kennedy, Ian Smith, Andrew Daddo, Lisa McCune, Brett Climo, Vince Gil and William McInnes.

results.title: Bob and Bobek. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Bob and Bobek are two lovable white rabbits who will delight children up to eight years of age. Their adventures are well suited for younger children who will identify with the characters and the situations in which they become involved. We follow their misadventures as they travel the globe. Bobek becomes a hero “At the airport” when he accidentally catches a smuggler. They go “On board ship” for a trip on a paddle steamer that they will never forget. A monster “In the forest” is scaring all the animals until the two rabbits arrive. They upset a champion athlete “At the athletics carnival”. The abominable snowman upsets their fun “In the mountains”. A nasty man steals their magic hat/home and plans a worse fate for them in “The hat”.

results.title: Bob's birthday and the best of British animation
results.creator_credit: Alison Snowden, Daniel Greaves, David Fine and Connoisseur Video
results.brief_description: A compilation containing six short animated films which have received Academy Award nominations for Best Animated Short Film since 1984. “Bob’s birthday” (1995 Oscar) is David Fine and Alison Snowden’s hilarious look at a mid-life crisis; “Creature comforts” (1991 Oscar) from the Aardman Animation studios; “Manipulation” (1992 Oscar) is Daniel Greaves’ brilliant battle between a cartoon character and his creator; “Adam” (1992 nomination), again from the Aardman studios; “Second class mail” (1984 nomination) is Alison Snowden’s graduation film, another wryly amusing look at growing old; and “The Big story” (1995 nomination), Tim Watts and David Stoten’s take on Billy Wilder, featuring no less than three Kirk Douglases in the starring roles and screened in the UK as the support to “Pulp fiction”.
results.title_for_label: Bob’s birthday and the best of British animation

results.title: BMX Bandits
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.brief_description: Action filled fun entertainment, BMX Bandits stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.description: PJ, Goose and Judy are three teenagers saving to buy BMX bikes. In their efforts, they stumble across a case of smuggled walkie-talkies needed by a bunch of crooks for their next job. Accidentally, while testing them, the teenagers alert the police on the same airwave band. The rest of the film becomes a BMX packed chase as the crooks and the police seek the trio. Action filled fun entertainment, “BMX bandits” stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

results.title: BMX
results.creator_credit: Lew Adams and Chaparral Productions Inc
results.brief_description: Follows the progress of a BMX race. An exciting film in which cyclists dodge mudholes, leap humps, shave corners and glide in slow motion. Useful for language arts, film making, art, social studies as a discussion starter or to spark a creative writing experience.
results.description: Follows the progress of a BMX race. An exciting film in which cyclists dodge mudholes, leap humps, shave corners and glide in slow motion. Useful for language arts, film making, art, social studies as a discussion starter or to spark a creative writing experience.

results.title: Blush = Hong fen
results.creator_credit: Li Shaohong, Cheng Zhigu, Chen Kunming, Jimmy Tan, Beijing Salon Films and Ocean Films
results.brief_description: Qiuyi and Xiaoe are friends and prostitutes, working in a Shanghai brothel at the end of the 1940’s. It is a time of social upheaval as the Communist Revolution forces them to change their profession and assume ‘normal’ lives. With this normalacy comes trouble, as they both fall in love with the same man. The strain begins to show in their relationship and the two become separated when Quiyi escapes imprisonment by hiding in the home of a former client and Xiaoe becomes trained as a uniformed factory worker. Described as belonging to the renaissance of Asian Cinema, “Blush” is as much about the challenges faced by women during social upheaval as it is about revolutionary change. Cast includes He Saifei and Wang Zhiwen In Mandarin with English subtitles.
